answers.answer: Hi.  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  Congratulations on your successful pregnancy.  As you probably know, the tighter control you can maintain during your pregnancy the better.  I suspect that you didn't have that good control during your first pregnancy, because of the complications you note.  So if you're interested in having another child, and that is a decision you'll have to work out with your endocrinologist, the very first thing you must do is get as absolutely tight control on your diabetes as you can.  Test more frequently, even doubling the number of tests you do.  Get on an insulin pump, if you can.  Anything and everything you can do to gain that control.  Then if you are fortunate enough to become pregnant, double your efforts to dial it in even more.  That control is the key.  Good luck to you.

question: Hi I am a 34 year old Type 1 diabetic (31) years. I have a beautiful healthy 5 year old daughter. I suffered some severe complications during my pregnancy eye complications ( left eye retinopathy) we have done several surgery) I can still see out of the eye but not very well all 3 of the doctors (endocrinologist  , Ophthalmologist, and high risk Obstetrics all stated this could happen, even to myself who was very healthy and had great A1C for several years before coming pregnant to say the least I was under very tight control. I also has part of my cervix removed due to dx; severe high Cervical dysplasia . I love nothing more than being a mommy and I would love to have another one, I am so blessed with one and dont want to sound selfish, I was just wondering if anyone else had any of these problems and if they had any more children and if so how was the pregnancy and your health.
title: Type 1 Diabetic pregnancy risk
